page.title: 16Hampden Park Football Ground
page.content: Hampden football ground is in the south side of Glasgow. It is conveniently situated for 2 railway stations. In the Hampden building there are many rooms. The board room has all the trophies on display which Queen's Park A.F.C have won. In the changing rooms there is a large square bath called a plunge. There are also showers and ordinary baths. If players are nervous before a game they can sit behind a partition to read. Upstairs there are dark rooms and a teleprinter room for use by the press. Photographs can be developed and sent directly to the newspaper office ready to be printed. The press box has seats for 280 reporters. The best view of the pitch is from the press box as its sloping windows do not give a reflection. In May 1985 Hampden passed its safety inspection.
